output_text: {"id":"audit-spec-plan-001","steps":[{"name":"Scope and structure review","ok":true,"reason":"Identify document purpose, audience, boundaries, and completeness of major sections (requirements, assumptions, constraints, interfaces, acceptance criteria). Note missing or ambiguous areas."},{"name":"Requirement quality and consistency check","ok":true,"reason":"Evaluate each requirement for clarity, testability, and traceability. Flag vague language, contradictions, duplicates, and misaligned terminology across sections and with referenced documents."},{"name":"Risk, validation, and stakeholder alignment assessment","ok":true,"reason":"Check that risks, edge cases, and non-functional needs are covered; confirm validation/acceptance methods exist; and verify that responsibilities, approvals, and change-control expectations are clearly defined."}],"final":"Use these three steps to systematically review scope and structure, requirement quality and consistency, and then risks, validation, and stakeholder alignment to complete a focused audit of the spec document."}
